title: (x) clean sans serif - Berthold Akzidenz-Grotesk {Stephen}
content:
I would like to know what it is so I can use it for my resume.

Can someone help me?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [bodytext.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020192422/http:/typophile.com/files/bodytext.jpg) | 12.59 KB |
author: newbie_chez

comments.content: [Akzidenz Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020192422/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/akzidenz-grotesk-bq/?refby=typographica) with improper apostrophes. Unless you're sending your resume to Berthold, you could get by with Helvetica instead.

Thank you so much!

On the subject of Resumes, if you happen to know any examples of nice resume layouts, please let me know.

You're supposed to be a designer - create one yourself!

Nick Cooke
Are you telling me that as a designer you are too good to look for inspiration?

Hell, I even design the typefaces to be used on my resume Cheryl! That's how good I am!

But seriously, I must admit I was pretty clueless for many years after I had left college, and it's only now that I'm no spring chicken any longer that I feel I know what I'm doing.

You should see some of the crap I churned out when working on Prima magazine (yes! knitting patterns, bake your own advent scene, etc – that Prima) Or maybe not.

The above comment was just a slight dig at people who use Typophile as a resource for 'I can't be bothered thinking of anything – I'll let some other sucker do it for me, and just copy what they do'.

Sorry if you were offended. It's not bad to seek inspiartion. Plagiarism is the bad thing.

Nick Cooke
